condition.narrative: Section I.B of Schedule 2 to the Loan Agreement. In order to ensure the proper carrying out of the Program, the Borrower, throughthe National Forestry and Grassland Administration shall provide technical guidance to the Program Implementing Entity, monitorProgram implementation, coordinate with other agencies and carrying out knowledge dissemination.

Section I.B.1 of Schedule to the Program Agreement. The Program Implementing Entity shall maintain, and cause to be maintained,the following entities, with composition, powers, functions, staffing, facilities and other resources acceptable to the Bank: (a)the Provincial Greening/Afforestation Committee, responsible for providing leadership, policy guidance and coordination in thepreparation and implementation of the Program; (b) Provincial Forestry and Grasslands Bureau, to be responsible for the overallcoordination, management and supervision of the Program, including coordination of technical, fiduciary, environmental and socialaspects, and provision of guidance to the line departments, municipalities, counties and other relevant stakeholders on Programimplementation at the national and provincial level; and (c) the forestry bureau of each Program County, responsible forimplementation of the Program at the county level, coordinating day-to-day activities with the Provincial Forestry and GrasslandsBureau and other agencies, and monitoring Program implementation within the county concerned.

Section I.B.2 of the Schedule to the Program Agreement. The Program Implementing Entity shall, and shall cause the Program Countiesto: (a) undertake the actions set forth in the Program Action Plan; (b) not amend, revise or waive, nor allow to be amended,revised or waived, the provisions of the Program Action Plan, or any provision thereof, without the prior written agreement of theBank; and (c) maintain policies and procedures adequate to enable it to monitor and evaluate, in accordance with guidelinesacceptable to the Bank, the implementation of the Program Action Plan.

Section III.2 of the Schedule to the Program Agreement. The Program Implementing Entity shall prepare, under terms of referenceacceptable to the Bank, and furnish to the Bank no later than September 30, 2021, a consolidated mid-term review report for theProgram, summarizing the results of the monitoring and evaluation activities carried out from the inception of the Program, andsetting out the measures recommended to ensure the efficient completion of the Project Program and to further the objectivesthereof.

Section III.4 of the Schedule to the Program Agreement. The Program Implementing Entity shall, not later than April 30, 2020, hire,and thereafter maintain, throughout the period of Program implementation, verification agents having experience and qualificationsin the relevant technical fields, acceptable to the Bank, and under terms of reference, including a time-table and adequate budgetfor its activities, acceptable to the Bank, to monitor and verify the achievement of the DLRs.

title.narrative: A proposal developed for the improvement of the forestry payments for environmental services (PES) system at the national level andin Sichuan Province
Development of a forest carbon trading institutional framework and technical support system
Provincial forest germplasm resources survey report delivered with Sichuan forest species list developed
Financial management and internal controls of the Provincial Forestry and Grassland Bureau strengthened
Increase in CO2 sequestration by the Program.
Number of sylvicultural technical standards/regulations for rare species and mixed forest management developed and in use
Number of hectares of Improved Mixed-species Plantations having a survival rate of 85 percent at the end of the first year after planting
Of which, trainings received by women
Number of hectares of degraded and monoculture forests restored using a diversified forest structure
Number of farmers and county-level staff received trainings
Number of provincial, county and forest farms long-term forest management plans developed
Increase in women applying for government subsidized afforestation and forest management programs
Increase in the areas of mixed-species planting in the Program areas in Sichuan
Budget performance management system in Sichuan Forestry and Grassland Sector standardized and improved
Computerized monitoring and information system established
Institutional capacity improved with enabling conditions created for scaling up sustainable forest ecosystem management
